Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role

Thriller, starring Stellan Skarsgard, Melissa George, Ashley Walters and Selma Blair

David Cronenberg's surreal horror, starring James Woods, Sonja Smits, Deborah Harry and Peter Dvorsky

Horror Western, starring Wesley Snipes and Kevin Howarth

But as Gently and Bacchus begin their search for the man, things soon become complicated. His psychiatrist reveals he was showing signs of schizophrenia, while his brother claims he was far too soft to have killed a man - and when a second body turns up, the duo are led into a world of medical secrets at an Army testing facility. Drama, starring MyAnna Buring and Tim McInnerny

Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah, Mark Bonnar and Michelle Fairley

programme.desc: Sgt Matthew Boyden and PC Cameron Tait investigate a violent incident at a local school, while PC Luke Ashton risks his life to save a girl trapped in a burning toilet block - but she and her friend flee the scene before they can be questioned. programme.title: The Bill

However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star

Christmas edition from 1998, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with Rik Mayall and Hannah Gordon

Crime thriller, starring Idris Elba, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Lee Ingleby

programme.desc: Sean becomes prime suspect when Leonie is raped, and the authorities believe he could be responsible for the string of murders Andy and the team have been investigating. programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house hunting with a couple who have a budget of 650,000 and want to quit the city to find a house with great entertaining potential in the Cheshire countryside. programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts a Eurovision Song Contest special of the quiz, inviting contestants to answer general knowledge questions against the clock, banking money as the do so and hoping rival contenders will not vote them off the team

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special Eurovision episode of the star-studded general knowledge quiz.: AJ Odudu, Richie Anderson, Antony Costa, Jay Aston, Eimear Quinn, Linda Martin, Dadi Freyr and Mans Zelmerlow try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win money for charity

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a special Eurovision episode of the music quiz show. Three teams, each pairing a celebrity with a Eurovision fan, must name as many songs and artists as possible under intense pressure. Returning to The Hit List are former champions Scott Mills and Clara Amfo, who will be joined by fellow DJ Adele Roberts to compete for the chance to win 10,000 for charity

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan are live in Liverpool with this curtain-raiser to the Eurovision Song Contest

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Graham Norton, Hannah Waddingham, Alesha Dixon and Julia Sanina present the 67th annual song competition from Liverpool, with singer-songwriter Mae Muller representing the UK with I Wrote a Song. The show also features performances from last year's first and second place acts, Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra and the UK's Sam Ryder, as well as a celebration of the host city's incredible contribution to the world of pop music featuring six past Eurovision winners - including Liverpool's own Sonia. Graham also shares commentary duties with Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie (2016)
programme.desc: Worried about her finances when her book fails to find a publisher, Patsy is given the tip that Kate Moss has left her PR company and will be looking for new representation. Things start to go awry when the plot to approach the model goes horribly wrong and Patsy and Edina find themselves vilified by the entire nation and have to flee the country. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Rachel Burden present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leeds United v Newcastle United at Elland Road and Aston Villa v Tottenham Hotspur at Villa Park. Leeds are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Newcastle are looking to secure a top-four finish. Should the Magpies have faltered, Villa and Spurs will both have been looking to capitalise to maintain their own outside chance of Champions League qualification. Plus, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest, Crystal Palace v Bournemouth, Manchester United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Southampton v Fulham

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Politics London
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle present a selection of tales of romance and heartache at Longleat, including the burgeoning relationship between two rare Amur tigers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team follows the development progress of properties in Mablethorpe in Lincolnshire, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire and Norwich

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help two teams look for items at the Royal Cornwall Showground, while presenter Charlie Ross visits Smeaton's Tower in Plymouth

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores how Christians are improving their mental health and wellbeing including those inspired by Kintsugi, the traditional Japanese art of embracing imperfection

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Manchester United (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Wembley Stadium. Chelsea have lifted this trophy in each of the last two seasons, overcoming Manchester City in last season's contest. However, they face a major threat to their supremacy from the Red Devils, who have also pushed them all the way in the Super League and will be hoping to win their first major honour in women's football

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Furniture experts, horologists, metal workers, ceramicists and upholsterers try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a Cornwall farm to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: British Academy Television Awards
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the awards show from the Royal Festival Hall, celebrating the year's finest TV moments in front of a star-studded audience and members of the royal family. Shows in the running for awards include Bad Sisters, The Responder, Sherwood, Somewhere Boy, Am I Being Unreasonable?, Big Boys, Derry Girls, Ghosts, Friday Night Live, The Graham Norton Show, Taskmaster and Would I Lie To You?

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Drama about British immigrants to Australia in the 1950s. In dreary post-war Manchester, Annie Roberts is at her wits end when husband Terry spends all his wages down the pub. Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, including Everton v Manchester City at Goodison Park and Arsenal v Brighton & Hove Albion at Emirates Stadium, as City and Arsenal continued to fight for the title against an Everton side battling to avoid relegation and the European football-chasing Seagulls. Plus, Brentford v West Ham United and a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Michah Richards and Alan Shearer to count down the best penalty takers in Premier League history

programme.title: Mindhorn (2016)
programme.desc: Richard Thorncroft, the star of 1980s sci-fi cop show Mindhorn, sets out to make it in Hollywood, but ends up with his life and career in ruins. Years later, he gets the chance to be a real hero when the police need his help. A dangerous fugitive is on the loose, who believes Detective Mindhorn is real and will only speak to him. Comedy, starring Julian Barratt, Essie Davis and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph boards a ferry to view a traditional cottage in Ventnor on the Isle of Wight, while Dion Dublin checks out an end-terrace in Bradford as well as following a two-year project in Derby to build eight homes on land formerly used as garages and workshops

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader submerges himself in the famous hot springs of Saturnia. He also joins Italy's last surviving cowboys, known as the Butteri, to learn how to lasso and barbecue the perfect steak

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Another two food brands seek investment. Naked Dough, operating as a pop-up in London, serves a vegan-friendly dough developed by pastry chef and co-founder Jen. They now want 250,000 to open their own shop. Premium burger stall Black Bear Burger has allowed husband and wife Liz and Stew to leave their jobs and focus full-time on the business. Now they want to take the next step but they need investment if they are to open a proper outlet. Fred Sirieix meets the teams and follows their pitches

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox reveals how the unique properties of light provide an insight into the origins and evolution of both mankind and the universe. He charts the importance of light in the development of the world's ancient civilisations, and explains how the speed of light allows the measurement of both distance and time - before pinpointing one of the most important moments in the evolution of life on Earth

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, but before the winner can be crowned remaining contestants Annie, Brogan, Debra and Man Yee have the small matter of three more fashion challenges. They begin by following the pattern for an amorphous dress, made from a single piece of elastene and manipulated into shape with a connection of D-rings. They are then presented with all their scraps from the previous weeks, from which they must create a party outfit, before fitting a made-to-measure red-carpet jumpsuit to their models. Who will impress judges Esme Young and Patrick Grant the most?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Jonathan Pratt find a collection of objects at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, and Paul Martin takes a ride along the Thames on an amphibious vehicle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes gelato and learns why it is healthier than ice cream, gets a makeover from Florence's most stylish man, and stays in a hotel that is a homage to Italian design

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson trials new blueberry bushes, and Calum Clunie demonstrates more garden produce to plant at home. One of the nation's favourite flowers, sweet peas, get planted out ready to bring colour and fragrance wherever they are cultivated, and Lizzie Schofield starts working with a family who has just moved into a new-build estate

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In a special programme from the RHS Malvern Spring Festival, Rachel de Thame and Nick Bailey explore show gardens and discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers. Elsewhere, Toby Buckland celebrates spring colour at Aberglasney Gardens in Carmarthenshire, and Arit Anderson spends the day with a charity group that gives horticultural work experience to vulnerable people and those with learning difficulties

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at some of the UK's most beautiful and historic homes, and people who are saving the past for all of us. This episode features Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, an Elizabethan masterpiece, commissioned by the formidable Bess of Hardwick in the late 1500s

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to the River Exe in Devon, where they fish for summer grilse, and a trip to the beach sees them try their hand at shore fishing. Away from the fishing, Bob finds a shady corner to prepare a vegan lunch for them both, using a special blend of car meat, and as the day draws to a close they head back to their accommodation and enjoy a game of cricket on the lawn, in which Bob proves himself to be surprisingly agile

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: The Echo Park gang are impressed when Ashley takes charge during a power outage. Australian comedy starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the competition the designers are split into teams of two to makeover two wooden lodges used as wedding accommodation on the banks of Rutland Water in the East Midlands. With one team working on the bridal lodge and the other on the groom's room they have 3,000, an army of tradespeople and just two days to create a winning design that will impress Michelle and guest judge Shayne Brady and secure them a place in the semi-final

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Jane Corbin travels to Taiwan to take viewers inside a story that has ramifications for all of us. In the process, she reveals China's 'playbook' as its desire to 'reunify the motherland' becomes ever clearer, and it could drag the world into a dangerous confrontation

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.desc: Happy is determined to splash in a puddle

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels and Duggee hold an election

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea takes all the books from the supermarket to build a huge tower, so Supertato, Chilli and Carrot try to rescue them by using acrobatic skills they learnt from a circus book

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farm is paid an unexpected visit from an escapee from the nearby prison who takes refuge in the barn

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Doctor Pfooflepfeffer covets the world-beating power of Gnasher's indestructible teeth

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids want to impress Gramps by completing the Gauntlet of Greatness carnival attraction that he did when he was their age

programme.title: Odd Squad

programme.desc: Stunt Tomato amazes the judges with a magic trick

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Cam, Tyler and Aaron explore the wonders of the UK's wetlands

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The team celebrates Eurovision with a party with special guest Freya Skye and an audience of Ukrainian children

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall goes in search of predators with super-senses, including a noctule bat, a sperm whale and a copperhead snake

programme.title: Born in China (2016)
programme.desc: Wildlife documentary telling the stories of a panda and her cub, a young golden monkey and his sister and a mother snow leopard struggling to raise her two cubs in their homeland of China. Narrated by John Krasinski

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates a look at the different methods animals use to attract a mate, revealing how inventive, loving and complex they can be. A female polar bear tries to revive a male's interest in her by turning cartwheels in front of him, while a bird of paradise tidies obsessively as he prepares a stage for his dance. While other lemurs are fighting for the right to breed, one sidles up to a female and wins favour by wafting his scent at her, and silverback gorilla seduction involves staring with a fixed grin

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks host the culinary competition, with four teams facing a series of challenges based on everyday meals. The opening edition sees the Whites from Hampshire, the Penmans from Lincolnshire, the Stones from Dorset and the Abimbola-Younges from London compete, with three families going forward to the next stage

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: As a boy, frogs were the first animals David Attenborough kept and today he is still just as passionate about them. In this film, he takes viewers into the weird and wonderful world of the amphibian, shedding new light on the charismatic, colourful and frequently bizarre creatures, and examining their anatomy, extraordinary behaviour and ability to survive in some of the most extreme places on the planet

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The eight week long expedition comes to an end as the contestants race to the final check point at the most-easterly point of the North American continent. The pairs reflect on their journey so far and the ways it has changed them both physically and emotionally as they reach the finish line and find out who will be crowned winners and welcomed into the Race Across the World hall of fame

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: James Lewis and Nick Davies examine antiques brought to them at the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, Hampshire, while Paul Martin finds out about the town's industrial heritage

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The treasure-hunting challenge returns, with actor and comedian Les Dennis and former Eastenders star Nitin Ganatra searching for items in the north-west of England, with the expert help of David Harper and Irita Marriott

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at some of the UK's most beautiful and historic homes, and people who are saving the past for all of us. This episode features Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, an Elizabethan masterpiece, commissioned by the formidable Bess of Hardwick in the late 1500s

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: With the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard now established, Captain Mainwaring sets about trying to get equipment for the platoon so they can see off potential Nazi invaders. Classic comedy first shown in 1968, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd (2015)
programme.desc: A headstrong Victorian woman inherits a sheep farm in a remote area of Dorset. She struggles to maintain her independence while being courted by three very different men - a stoic farmer, a dashing, reckless soldier and a lonely older man. Period drama based on Thomas Hardy's novel, starring Carey Mulligan, Matthias Schoenaerts, Tom Sturridge and Michael Sheen

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leeds United v Newcastle United at Elland Road and Aston Villa v Tottenham Hotspur at Villa Park. Leeds are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Newcastle are looking to secure a top-four finish. Should the Magpies have faltered, Villa and Spurs will both have been looking to capitalise to maintain their own outside chance of Champions League qualification. Plus, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest, Crystal Palace v Bournemouth, Manchester United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Southampton v Fulham

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Zoe Lyons introduces fellow comedians Ria Lina and Tom Ward to the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. All three share their light-hearted views on modern life

programme.title: Sam Ryder Rocks New Year's Eve
programme.desc: The Eurovision star sees in 2023 in a New Year's Eve concert at Riverside Studios in Hammersmith, with guest appearances by Melanie C, Sigrid and Justin Hawkins of the Darkness. Featuring a Queen medley, a cover of Beyonc's Break My Soul with the House Gospel Choir, and a selection of Taylor Swift songs, as well as Ryder's own originals Space Man and All the Way Over

programme.title: Pride Hits at the BBC
programme.desc: A musical celebration of Pride, with performances by artists including Kylie Minogue, Elton John, Lady Gaga, Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Dolly Parton and Dusty Springfield. Featuring a playlist including Relax, Smalltown Boy, Born This Way, I Will Survive and Glad to Be Gay

programme.title: Who You Think I Am (2018)
programme.desc: A middle-aged woman is concerned her younger lover is losing interest in her. She creates a fake online profile of a 24-year-old woman, and forms an online relationship with her lover's flatmate in the hope of keeping tabs on him - but the deception proves to have devastating consequences. Drama based on Camille Laurens' novel, starring Juliette Binoche and Nicole Garcia. In French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In a special programme from the RHS Malvern Spring Festival, Rachel de Thame and Nick Bailey explore show gardens and discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers. Elsewhere, Toby Buckland celebrates spring colour at Aberglasney Gardens in Carmarthenshire, and Arit Anderson spends the day with a charity group that gives horticultural work experience to vulnerable people and those with learning difficulties

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson trials new blueberry bushes, and Calum Clunie demonstrates more garden produce to plant at home. One of the nation's favourite flowers, sweet peas, get planted out ready to bring colour and fragrance wherever they are cultivated, and Lizzie Schofield starts working with a family who has just moved into a new-build estate

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Cipond visits the biggest National Nature reserve in the country, Mar Lodge Estate. Covering 29,000 hectares, with 15 munros of the eastern Cairngorms, he sees the major regenerative work in the restoration of the ancient Caledonian forest. He also reports on a project on the other side of the Cairngorm mountains that will see the release of captively bred Scottish wildcats later this spring. Arlene Stuart heads to the Scottish Rural College near Dumfries to get some hands-on experience of lambing outdoors, while Cammy meets inspiring next generation farmers

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The remaining families from yesterday's heat face a surprise salted caramel tart challenge, as they compete for a place in Friday's play-off. Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks present

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall for a discussion on the best of British food, with the River Cottage chef cooking a classic roast chicken to go up against the host's stew and dumplings. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack samples a wine made in London and restaurateur Oliver Peyton puts cured meats from the UK under the spotlight

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Celia Imrie looks at the careers of leading British actresses, including Emma Thompson, Diana Rigg, Julie Walters, Elizabeth Taylor, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Helen Mirren

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
programme.desc: Eccentric English and American women living in Florence during the tense pre-war years of the 1930s experience the ups and downs of parenthood when they collectively adopt a local boy disowned by his father. However, as international hostilities break out, their happy existence comes under threat. Period comedy drama, starring Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Joan Plowright, Cher, Lily Tomlin and Baird Wallace

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Southwell, near Nottingham, where experts Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey assess antiques and collectibles brought in by members of the public. Paul also finds out how Southwell Minster has had a cavalcade of historical figures pass through the doors, from Cardinal Wolsey to Charles I, at some dramatic moments in British history

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the first time since the end of the race, the contestants reunite to reflect on their journeys and reveal insights into their strategies. The racers compare experiences, share their highest highs and lowest lows and talk about what they learned along the way

programme.title: Commando: Britain's Ocean Warriors
programme.desc: Following a serious injury, corporal Ollie is on his second attempt to fulfil a lifetime's dream to join the coveted ranks of the Mountain Leaders, the most elite unit within the Royal Marines. From the gruelling cliffs of Cornwall to the wilds of Northern Scotland and finally to the Arctic, this is one of the world's most elite military jobs and getting in is extremely tough, so Ollie hopes that this year he'll make the grade

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of southern Spain, travelling from Valencia to Torremolinos and finding out about the influence of the Moors, who invaded the country in the early eighth century. Along the way, they visit one of the most fertile areas in Spain, get their hands on a freshly caught octopus, go for a mud bath and learn about flamenco, giving Dave a chance to show off his dance moves. Finally, they cook tapas for the San Juan midsummer night festival, where they reflect upon their entire Mediterranean adventure

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace spends the day in the York factory where the famous Polo mints are made, to follow the process from grading the sugar, making the dough and drying the mixture to adding the flavour and pressing the sweets into their famous mini doughnut shape. Cherry Healey visits the largest sugar beet factory in Europe and historian Ruth Goodman explores the clever marketing that persuaded many people to purchase minty mouthwash

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ulster Folk Museum near Belfast, where finds include a collection of dolls with eyes that change colour, an early Louis Vuitton trunk, an unusual black opal, and a pair of vintage Guinness signs. Mark Smith gets a rare chance to see medals awarded to participants in the Easter Rising in Dublin in 1916, while Fiona meets the Armagh Rhymers, a folk group who dress in wicker costumes and preserve the ancient tradition of storytelling known as mumming

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America
programme.desc: Simon starts his travels through Brazil in one of the remotest regions of the Amazon with the Waiapi people, who cling on to their traditional way of life, which is under threat from logging and mining interests. In Manaus, the city at the heart of the Amazon, he visits a neglected indigenous neighbourhood and meets a nurse who was the only source of healthcare during the pandemic. Simon ends this leg of his journey on the west coast in the city of Rio de Janeiro, where the government has built a hi-tech control room to monitor all parts of the city for potential disasters such as floods

programme.title: The Mauritanian (2021)
programme.desc: Believed by US intelligence to be the main recruiter for the 9/11 attacks, Mohamedou Ould Slahi is picked up from his home village in Mauritania and taken to Guantanamo Bay without charge. His case is taken up by New Mexico lawyer Nancy Hollander, who is determined to take the US government to task for unlawful detention. Fact-based legal drama, starrring Tahar Rahim, Jodie Foster, Shailene Woodley and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome star guests and members of the public to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in the East Sussex town of Bexhill-on-Sea to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.desc: The comedian heads to Jordan as she takes on more of the world's endangered jobs, learning how to be a Dead Sea lifeguard and spending a night in the desert with a family of Bedouin herders on the lookout for dangerous animals

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Paul McCartney at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of TV appearances from the musician's post-Beatles career, featuring performances of songs including Band on the Run, Jet, Coming Up and Live and Let Die on programmes from Top of the Pops to the Electric Proms. There is also rarely seen backstage footage and interviews, as well as appearances by a range of familiar faces, including a recent encounter with die-hard Beatles fan Bob Mortimer

programme.title: Rock Family Trees
programme.desc: The Liverpool music scene of the 1960s, an era synonymous with the band that changed the face of pop music - the Beatles. Pete Frame narrates the story of such bands including the Searchers, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Billy J Kramer, the Swinging Blue Jeans and the Merseybeats

programme.title: Everything: The Real Thing Story
programme.desc: The rise of four working class boys from one of Liverpool's toughest neighbourhoods, who fought hardship and discrimination to become the biggest-selling black group in British pop history. With a string of hits, they dominated the international charts throughout the 1970s with iconic songs like You to Me Are Everything, Can't Get by Without You, and Can You Feel the Force. Hpwever the group's meteoric success was also tempered with personal tragedy, drug addiction and racial prejudice. Narrated by Jacob Anderson

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: East 17 singers Brian Harvey and Tony Mortimer present chart hits from September 8, 1994, featuring Blondie, Corona, the Wonder Stuff, Cyndi Lauper, Oasis, Pet Shop Boys, Kylie Minogue, Bon Jovi, Wet Wet Wet and Whigfield

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon host the edition first aired on May 14 1992. Featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, the Wedding Present, Del Amitri, Kris Kross, En Vogue, Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson, CeCe Peniston and KWS

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath

programme.title: Inspector Montalbano
programme.desc: Feature-length final episode of the Italian crime drama. Montalbano grapples with the murder of the leader of an amateur dramatics company whose peculiar take on theatre borders on fanaticism. His assailant stabbed him in the chest, but without leaving a trace of blood. Might the key to discovering the identity of the killer be bound up in Catalanotti's disturbing conception of the stage? In Italian

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Denardo explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Wattis, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto concludes his travels in the south of Italy, where his family has lived for 500 years. He explores the rock caves of Matera, attends Nocera's Easter celebrations and finds out about collapsible houses designed to help the residents avoid paying taxes. He also visits Sicily, where he takes a trip to Mount Etna and the catacombs of Palermo

programme.title: The Tragedy of Macbeth
programme.desc: James McArdle and Saoirse Ronan star in this critically acclaimed production of the Shakespeare play about one couple's spine-chilling quest for power, directed by Yal Farber and captured during its 2021 run at the Almeida Theatre. In the ruins of a theatre, three witches make a prophecy. A warrior and his wife enter the darkness. A war begins

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob examines the work of controversial artists Gilbert and George as they prepare for the opening of their recent retrospective at the Tate Modern. This intimate portrait considers how the pair's working relationship functions and also includes a look inside their East End home, where they have lived for the past 40 years

programme.title: Ian Hislop's Fake News: A True History
programme.desc: The Private Eye editor explores the history of dishonest news reporting over the past 200 years, investigating how the rivalry between press barons Joseph Pulitzer and William Randolph Hearst may have contributed to an actual war. The programme also looks at the influence of technology, from early trick photography to modern deepfakes, and features the owner of a Washington pizza parlour who has been on the receiving end of one of the modern world's most infamous conspiracy theories

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: The second episode looks at the final downfall of the Nazi regime following Hitler's suicide and the disassembling of the Wehrmacht, and examines how life changed for the people of Berlin under occupation by the victorious Soviet army

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto concludes his travels in the south of Italy, where his family has lived for 500 years. He explores the rock caves of Matera, attends Nocera's Easter celebrations and finds out about collapsible houses designed to help the residents avoid paying taxes. He also visits Sicily, where he takes a trip to Mount Etna and the catacombs of Palermo

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?

Disa makes a milk mixture, sweetened with honey, and mixes it into flour to make a dough. She then grinds her special ingredient of cardamom into a powder and adds some into the dough and the rest of it into brown sugar. The dough is flattened, the brown sugar and cardamom mix is spread onto the dough and folded in. The dough is then cut into strips and twisted and wrapped into a bun ready to be baked. programme.desc: Lily's father decides to move the family out of the Lake District, so Peter comes up with a clever but dangerous plan to change his mind

programme.title: Pfffirates
programme.desc: Lily comes across some special fruits capable of turbo-boosting the Korsairs' boat

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must decide whether objects will float or sink in a water tank. Then, in a game based on light and shadows, the young scientists have to figure out what their team captains are holding by observing their shadows behind a huge screen. Finally, the teams learn about structures by building arched bridges they can step across to reach an island. Meanwhile, Sam and Ayo are competing to see who can make the best model rocket. The scientist who loses must clean the others dirty lab beakers for a week! Who will triumph?

programme.title: Pinocchio and Friends
programme.desc: The school is having a couples' Halloween costume contest, and Candlewick is sad because he doesn't have anyone to go with. Freeda is determined to help him find someone, and when she finds out that Pinocchio is also looking for a partner for the lovely Lucilla, the situation seems to be solved. But, the terrible Billy Bob is up to something: he is not happy about being excluded from the contest...

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: After a successful trip to the dentist, Nick tells Norman all about the tooth fairy. Does the tooth fairy visit dogs? Along with the help of the Popcasters, they write a song about looking after your teeth.

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: Ruby sings an upbeat song in which she imagines what it is like to be a raindrop falling from the sky

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran take the bus to visit the art gallery. JoJo wants to find paintings of pandas, so they join a tour with curator Marie and see lots of different type of art, and experience how abstract art makes them feel. JoJo cant find any paintings of pandas but realises art isn't just for looking at it's for making too! JoJo makes lots of panda art and creates her own gallery in Gran Gran's garden.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Jessica's family is from Ukraine, a country found in Eastern Europe. This region is known for a soup called borscht, and Jessica will be making some for her friends. Jessica cooks cabbage and spring onions in oil and then adds them to grated carrot, beetroot, potatoes and a tomato and stock mixture. All of these ingredients are combined in a casserole dish. Once they are stirred together, the casserole dish can be placed in the oven to cook. Jessica wears a traditional Ukrainian outfit and serves drinks in a beautiful drinks dispenser. Borscht is famous for being brightly coloured, so will her friends be able to guess that her special ingredient is beetroot?

programme.title: Old Jack's Boat: Rockpool Tales
programme.desc: Veteran seafarer Old Jack recalls when Little Sailor Sue lost a button and tells his faithful companion Salty dog about the day Belinda the Blenny found one in the rockpool

programme.title: Gecko's Garage
programme.desc: Time for Gecko's carwash after Baby Truck plays in muddy puddles

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: While walking in the country, Duggee starts to sing a song and marches ahead, while the squirrels march behind him and join in

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are rushing around, so Duggee shows them how to enjoy things at a slower pace. However, they soon come across Tortoise, who needs to get to the hospital as his wife is having babies. Duggee and the Squirrels need to get him there fast

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy Monster cannot work out why his cart will not move, so he and Okido try to find out the answer

programme.desc: Princess Purl has one more task to complete to stay a Princess. She must dance with the very rare Zippopopomus before the castle bell rings three times. If she fails, she stops being a princess

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: The hairy hero has to keep Elder Kitten busy while everyone organises a surprise party

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: The hairy hero can't find his favourite book that he borrowed from Book Cub, so he and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny play detective and retrace his steps to try and find it

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Ubercorn and Glitch have to team up when they get stuck at the most remote place on Earth.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Lars and Kyan swim through the shallows of Crystal River in Florida. Kyan tests his new swimming fin, while Lars watches a manatee and her baby cruise by. Xuli is water-skiing further downstream in the open waters of Crystal Bay, while Foz and Ubercorn watch on from Jet Pad. Grandmaster Glitch is taking the tourist family on a mermaid spotting tour of Crystal River aboard his Grimmer-boat. As Glitch heads off in search of real mermaids, he accidentally startles the mother manatee. Ubercorn realises the manatee will be in danger from the speeding boats and from the cold deep water. The Go Jetters need to mount a manatee rescue quickly. While Xuli attempts to stop the speedboats, Foz launches the Vroomster. The baby manatee has become attached to Kyan, so Lars suggests he remains with her, while Lars and Foz go to save the mother. Kyan is not happy at having to play baby-sitter.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its Potato dedicating a song to his uncle Spud, who went on a spaceship to the moon.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a garden, where they see lots of different vegetables! Meanwhile, Mr Tumble wants to surprise Grandad Tumble by planting some carrot seeds.

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers pretend to be trains on a walk to the library.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks Stall. She chooses the party popper and remembers the day she got it. Moira has put Bob forward for the Bridgetown Green Hero Award, and the winner will be announced at one oclock today! Bob becomes flustered at the thought of all the fuss, so Ruby suggests they go to the allotment to help pass the time. She promises theyll be back in time for the big announcement. At the allotment, Ruby finds a white feather and makes a wish, but she wont tell Magnus what it is. Magnus keeps trying to guess what Rubys wish is. Back at the Big Hub, Moira and Mrs Juniper are busy getting prepared, Moira wants everything to be perfect. Bob, Ruby and Magnus get so carried away with making a home for a caterpillar at the allotment that its after one oclock by the time they realise the time. Oh no, theyve missed the big announcement! Will Bob win the Green Hero Award? And will Magnus ever find out what Ruby wished for?

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Green stages a magic show to introduce her new friends Black and White. Learn the difference between light, bright and dark colours with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: George wants to find out all about prawns in todays episode. Chantelle meets some new friends at the beach and heads to the rock pools to search for prawns, whilst Rory goes to the north of Scotland to meet a local expert at the harbour. Chantelle and Rorys fact files help answer all of Georges questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, prawns are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Chantelle and the children play at being prawns with a game of 'Whats the Time, Mr Fish?'

programme.desc: Still reeling from the state she found her dad in last night, Niamh suggests he might be suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder following his car crash. Meanwhile, a blues festival take a sinister when a woman arrested for driving while intoxicated claims that she was spiked

Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts a special Eurovision show, with chefs Olia Hercules, Niklas Ekstedt and Donal Skehan. Olly Smith recommends drinks from across Europe

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc: The culinary expert meets those who get pleasure out of cooking for a crowd. In Liverpool, she joins the team from Homebaked Bakery, a goal kick away from Liverpool FC's stadium, who take on the job of feeding fans on match day. She also meets Andrew, whose passion to feed has led him to build a smokehouse in his suburban garden. Between these tales, Mary cooks up her own crowd-pleasing delights, including a platter of sticky soy and ginger pork, and a lamb rogan curry

Graham also shares commentary duties with Mel Giedroyc

Leeds are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Newcastle are looking to secure a top-four finish. Should the Magpies have faltered, Villa and Spurs will both have been looking to capitalise to maintain their own outside chance of Champions League qualification. Plus, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest, Crystal Palace v Bournemouth, Manchester United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Southampton v Fulham

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: In the first of two special programmes originally shown to celebrate the centenary of Dylan Thomas's birth, Derek Brockway strolls around the poet's home town of Swansea. Accompanied by actor Adrian Metcalfe, Derek sets off from Dylan's childhood home on Cwmdonkin Drive and walks through the city's parks and down to the seafront, before visiting some of the writer's haunts in later life. He then heads west to the Llansteffan peninsula where his guide, artist Osi Rhys Osmond, leads him through the countryside that was home to many of Dylan's relatives. They include his aunt's farm, which would provide the inspiration for the poem Fernhill

programme.title: Match of the Day Live

Chelsea have lifted this trophy in each of the last two seasons, overcoming Manchester City in last season's contest. However, they face a major threat to their supremacy from the Red Devils, who have also pushed them all the way in the Super League and will be hoping to win their first major honour in women's football

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway presents the second of two specials originally shown to celebrate the centenary of Dylan Thomas's birth. First he travels to the seaside town of New Quay on on Cardigan Bay, where the poet and writer lived with wife Caitlin during the Second World War. Jeff Towns, chairman of the Dylan Thomas Society, joins Derek to explain how Thomas was inspired to write some of his greatest work during this era. For his final walk, to Laugharne, the presenter is accompanied by Thomas's grandaughter Hannah Ellis, who reveals the significance of the town to both her grandparents and her family today

Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest - Everyone's a Winner
programme.desc: Taking top spot at Eurovision guarantees fame and fortune - but failing to win is no bar to success either. Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Comedy actress Diane Morgan hosts, as comedian Desiree Burch and journalist and Times Radio presenter Matt Chorley join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: BBC News at Ten

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome guests including comedian Joel Dommett and model Hannah Cooper - plus members of the public - to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan are live in Liverpool with this curtain-raiser to the Eurovision Song Contest

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Graham Norton, Hannah Waddingham, Alesha Dixon and Julia Sanina present the 67th annual song competition from Liverpool, with singer-songwriter Mae Muller representing the UK with I Wrote a Song. The show also features performances from last year's first and second place acts, Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra and the UK's Sam Ryder, as well as a celebration of the host city's incredible contribution to the world of pop music featuring six past Eurovision winners - including Liverpool's own Sonia. Graham also shares commentary duties with Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leeds United v Newcastle United at Elland Road and Aston Villa v Tottenham Hotspur at Villa Park. Leeds are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Newcastle are looking to secure a top-four finish. Plus, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest, Crystal Palace v Bournemouth, Manchester United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Southampton v Fulham

programme.title: Songs of Praise

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Manchester United (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Wembley Stadium. Chelsea have lifted this trophy in each of the last two seasons, overcoming Manchester City in last season's contest. However, they face a major threat to their supremacy from the Red Devils, who have also pushed them all the way in the Super League and will be hoping to win their first major honour in women's football

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Cipond visits the biggest National Nature reserve in the country, Mar Lodge Estate. Covering 29,000 hectares, with 15 munros of the eastern Cairngorms, he sees the major regenerative work in the restoration of the ancient Caledonian forest. He also reports on a project on the other side of the Cairngorm mountains that will see the release of captively bred Scottish wildcats later this spring. Arlene Stuart heads to the Scottish Rural College near Dumfries to get some hands-on experience of lambing outdoors, while Cammy meets inspiring next generation farmers

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a Cornwall farm to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: British Academy Television Awards
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the awards show from the Royal Festival Hall, celebrating the year's finest TV moments in front of a star-studded audience and members of the royal family. Shows in the running for awards include Bad Sisters, The Responder, Sherwood, Somewhere Boy, Am I Being Unreasonable?, Big Boys, Derry Girls, Ghosts, Friday Night Live, The Graham Norton Show, Taskmaster and Would I Lie To You?

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Drama about British immigrants to Australia in the 1950s. In dreary post-war Manchester, Annie Roberts is at her wits end when husband Terry spends all his wages down the pub. Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, including Everton v Manchester City at Goodison Park and Arsenal v Brighton & Hove Albion at Emirates Stadium, as City and Arsenal continued to fight for the title against an Everton side battling to avoid relegation and the European football-chasing Seagulls. Plus, Brentford v West Ham United and a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Michah Richards and Alan Shearer to count down the best penalty takers in Premier League history

programme.title: Mindhorn (2016)
programme.desc: Richard Thorncroft, the star of 1980s sci-fi cop show Mindhorn, sets out to make it in Hollywood, but ends up with his life and career in ruins. Years later, he gets the chance to be a real hero when the police need his help. A dangerous fugitive is on the loose, who believes Detective Mindhorn is real and will only speak to him. Comedy, starring Julian Barratt, Essie Davis and Steve Coogan

Shows in the running for awards include Bad Sisters, The Responder, Sherwood, Somewhere Boy, Am I Being Unreasonable?, Big Boys, Derry Girls, Ghosts, Friday Night Live, The Graham Norton Show, Taskmaster and Would I Lie To You?

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Drama about British immigrants to Australia in the 1950s. In dreary post-war Manchester, Annie Roberts is at her wits end when husband Terry spends all his wages down the pub. Desperate for a better life for her children, Annie responds to an emigration advert that promises a prosperous new life in Australia. Expecting whitewashed houses and sun-soaked adventures, the Roberts family arrive in Sydney to find life down under isn't quite what they've been sold. Starring Faye Marsay and Michelle Keegan

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd finds an entire sweetie, but when he is unable to move it on his own, he reluctantly leaves it in the care of a passing wasp while he gets Abacus and PB. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. When a demon attacks, Tang and Pigsy know their only choice is to wake the Monkey King from his mystic meditation. The Monkey King scares off the demon, but now he thinks that he's his younger self - when the demon kidnaps Tang, it's up to Pigsy and the Young Monkey King to rescue their friend. Meanwhile, Tang wakes up in the castle of a beautiful queen who 'rescued him from the demon', but he isn't buying it...

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Monkie Kid, Mei and Sandy find themselves stranded in the desert, but a familiar figure emerges to save them: Red Son is back! Bringing the trio to his family's fortress, the heroes overstay their welcome with the villainous trio as they try to find out everything they can about the creation of the Samadhi Fire... and soon realise that the first ring is there in the Demon Bull King's nose!

Mo enjoys zapping all those boring moments at first, but he soon realises that his buddy Lenny is now in big trouble because of him...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam's hymn about PDRAs is turned down by an animal welfare website. It must be said that Sam recorded herself on her own, playing a mouth-harp and the result was far from impressive. Stella sees how bad her friend feels about the rejection, even if Sam insists that she has moved onto another project. Stella decides to surprise her with another recording, a rock version of the hymn, convinced that this version will be accepted by the website.

John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Robert Stephens, Amanda Burton and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa's hippie mother Eleanor (Louise Jameson) arrives in the village, immediately taking over Martin's kitchen to prepare a herbal tonic, which she later gives to the baby to stop his crying. A culinary rivalry develops between Bert and Mark Bridge, the landlord of the Crab and Lobster pub, at Portwenn Fun Day, with both keen to take advantage of the event by providing food for the spectators

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is shocked by the unexpected arrival of his ex-wife Maggie (Julie Graham), who appears to have forgotten that they separated years ago and wants to know why he left her. Eleanor goes on a date with local fisherman Paul Hale, an old friend she has not seen since school, while Martin and Louisa finally agree on a name for their baby - James Henry. With Martin Clunes, John Marquez and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Bertie's circumstances change suddenly, leaving Edith uncertain whether to risk telling him the truth or keep her past a secret at all costs. Mary wonders if she can ever make peace with her sister as hostilities escalate, Spratt shows some hidden talents and Molesley's first day as a teacher does not go according to plan. Mrs Patmore's bed and breakfast attracts unwanted attention, leaving her in need of the Crawleys' help

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Julian Fellowes bids farewell to the Crawleys in the last small-screen episode, catching up with the Abbey's residents at the tail-end of 1925. Mary endeavours to build bridges, but Edith's secret continues to pose a threat. As Henry settles into the role of husband, scars left by Charlie's death are slow to heal, while Carson struggles to come to terms with developments that prove even he is not invulnerable to change. Spratt's moonlighting venture is threatened by the conniving of Denker, and Daisy may have missed her chance with an admirer. Isobel receives devastating news, while the day that Anna and Bates have long-since waited for arrives

programme.title: Downton Abbey (2019)
programme.desc: In 1927, Buckingham Palace informs Robert and Cora Crawley, the Earl and Countess of Grantham, that George V and Queen Mary will visit Downton Abbey during a royal tour through Yorkshire. The occasion soon unleashes scandal, romance and intrigue - leaving the future of Downton hanging in the balance. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Chief Superintendent Jack Cornish goes missing and a recently embalmed body is discovered near an isolated farm track - could there be a link? As Hathaway goes on sabbatical in Kosovo, Lewis takes an awkward young constable under his wing to investigate the case. Guest starring Lucy Speed and Peter Davison, with Kevin Whately and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After seven years of ducking the issue, Lewis and Hobson are embarking on a relationship, but the detective also has a new case to solve. Elderly don Richard Seager is murdered on the night of his release from prison, having served a sentence for causing death by dangerous driving. Crushed by a classic car, Seager mysteriously scratched the number 500 into its paintwork before his demise, and the academic's wife suspects a member of his victim's family is responsible for the killing. With Stephen Churchett, Alison Steadman and Edward Fox

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Irene's efforts to compose poetry reveal her increasing isolation and one of her missives prompts social workers to review Vera's claim to custody of grand-daughter Sabrina. Meanwhile, wine tips Irene over the edge. Comedy, based on the books and radio series by Carole Hayman and Lou Wakefield, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Irene finds herself living rough in the Outback after being rescued from the clinic by Karen and her new lover Damon, and Vera battles with social services for custody of Sabrina. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: As the Edwardian era draws to a close, the Bellamys' future hangs in the balance with Elizabeth continuing her attempts to break free of convention and James having a passionate reunion with Sarah, who has become a music-hall singer after her release from prison. Simon Williams, Nicola Pagett, Pauline Collins and Ian Ogilvy star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: In a retrospective episode set immediately after the events of series two, Rachel faces further accusations of masterminding the fatal attack on ex-lover Nick and finds comfort in the arms of ever-faithful Sean, agreeing to marry him. Amid the wedding celebrations, Janet and Ade admit defeat and decide to split up for good, while Gill is duty bound to take action when she catches Pete in a compromising position. The detectives also investigate the case of a businessman suspected of murdering a homeless man

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The father of a missing schoolgirl demands action, angry that a six-month investigation has failed to uncover any leads. Morse ends up being assigned the case - and discovers some unpleasant truths about her family and teachers during the course of his inquiries. John Thaw stars as the Oxford detective, with Kevin Whately, Peter Woodthorpe, Peter McEnery, Elizabeth Hurley and Frances Tomelty

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon begins to feel as though his life is passing far too quickly for his own good. Comedy about two rival antique dealers, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

Western, starring John Wayne and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Meeting bargain and bartering supremo Tony Carey and his wife Claire, who moved onto the Saydo Park community less than a year ago and bought their mobile home for an absolute steal. There is also a visit to familiar faces Joe and Jan, who have been married for 47 years, and handed over their animal charity last year to their friend Jacqui, in a bid to try and enjoy their retirement. Then the unthinkable happened, when 69-year-Jan was diagnosed with breast cancer

programme.title: Coastal Devon & Cornwall with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: This final part of Michael's adventure begins on Hope's Nose, a unique headland outside Torquay on the English Rivera, where Michael embraces as many experiences as he can along a coastline formed 280 million years ago, where limestone cliffs give way to eroding sandstone slopes. From exploring prehistoric caves by paddle board to digging for red clay on the Teign estuary, and racing a historic Cornish rowing boat, Michael is determined to capture as many coastal memories as he can, before returning to his urban life in London

It was a year when Bucks Fizz were losing their skirts, Adam and the Ants were re-inventing the pop video, and synthesizer bands were making it big. However, there was still room in the charts for the retro sound of Shakin' Stevens. Narrated by Tony Blackburn

programme.desc: Rob Bell travels to Bangor in north Wales, where he explores a lost line that was built in 1801 to transport Welsh slate from the local quarry, which once was the largest in the world, and now provides the backdrop for the world's fastest zip line. He also follows the Victorian railway inland to Llanberis, where tourists still flock to ride a special train to the summit of Snowdon, and discovers why the heirs to the throne have been styled 'Prince of Wales' for seven centuries
