programme.desc: The history of the exploration of Egypt's Valley of the Kings, and uncovers the stories of European explorers going in search of treasures in this long-lost desert chasm. He discovers the work of maverick engineer Giovanni Belzoni, who levered out statues of pharaohs, the rivalries that erupted between teams of explorers across Europe in search of long-buried treasures, and tells the story of the most famous discovery in the valley - Howard Carter's unearthing of Tutankhamun's Tomb

programme.title: Walking Britain's Lost Railways
programme.desc: Until it closed in 1966 the Deeside Railway followed the River Dee upstream from Aberdeen into what is now the Cairngorms National Park. As luck would have it, Queen Victoria purchased Balmoral just as the line was set to open, giving the route prestige. Rob Bell retraces the route, visiting a shooting estate, tossing a caber and finding an unmistakable Highland 'brand' that all owe their existence to this royal railway age. He also explores a quiet valley of cattle farming and timber sawmills, and, in truth, a simple railway that struggled for decades to justify its own existence, despite its royal veneer

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: A trip around the Inner Hebrides puts Jane in touch with her Scottish roots, as alongside just six other passengers the singer embarks on what is easily her smallest ever cruise. Jane enjoys unseasonably cloudless skies and sparkling seas as the route takes in the puffin-packed Treshnish Islands and Fingal's Cave on Staffa, the mythic rock formation that famously inspired Mendelssohn's Hebrides Overture. The excursion is rounded off with some traditional trappings, from ceilidhs and weaving to haggis-making

programme.title: Britain's Best Places to Live 2023
programme.desc: Each year, the Sunday Times publishes a list highlighting the most desirable and attractive locations, celebrating affordability, great schools, fast connectivity and good transport links. In this programme, Fern Britton is joined by Ore Oduba and Sunetra Sarker to count down the top 10, finding out what makes each place so special

programme.title: Challenge Anneka
programme.desc: Volunteers led by Anneka Rice have three days to help Age UK create a village for people with dementia, building seven shops, a green space, landscaping and an on-site cafe for carers to sit in and relax. The team hits the phones and it's not long before the build gets off to a flying start with tradespeople pouring in from all over the country, but a lack of materials becomes an issue and Anneka is soon knocking on the doors of local firms

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Iona Pennington inherited Muncaster Castle and estate in Cumbria, along with 1,700 acres, 40 tenanted properties, a hotel and two farms. In this programme, she swaps lives with self-made Liverpool businesswoman Kate Stewart, who came from a working-class background. Iona begins to understand the joys of new money when she meets Kate's stylist for a personal clothes-shopping session, while Kate starts to see Iona's sense of duty to the financial near bottomless pit of Muncaster

programme.title: The Teacher with Tourette's
programme.desc: Natalie Davidson is the only teacher in the UK with coprolalia - a rare form of Tourette's syndrome that causes her to swear. After leaving behind her job at a Birmingham comprehensive, she embarks on a challenge to help people with some of the most extreme cases of Tourette's find acceptance in the workplace. At the University of Nottingham, Natalie tests a pioneering piece of wearable technology that could be a game-changer for the Tourette's community, and potentially make their more explosive tics a thing of the past

programme.title: Kiss the Girls (1997)
programme.desc: A forensic psychologist hunts for a serial kidnapper stalking a university campus and responsible for his niece's disappearance. Working out of his jurisdiction, he defies local law enforcement officials to get to the truth - with the aid of one of the criminal's past victims, a headstrong doctor determined to see her former captor brought to justice. Thriller, starring Morgan Freeman, Ashley Judd, Cary Elwes and Tony Goldwyn

programme.title: Walking Britain's Lost Railways
programme.desc: Rob Bell heads to Norfolk to follow a lost railway through some of the quietest - yet wealthiest - parts of the country. This railway was a curious latecomer when it was built in the 1880s and it threatened to rudely thrust the region into the industrial age. Rob explores an entire engineering town built from scratch, learns how Norfolk's agriculture was super-charged, and sees for himself where thousands of holidaying Midlanders arrived to sail the Norfolk Broads. The line put Norfolk on the frontline of the war so Rob takes to the skies to spot dozens of hastily constructed airfields

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Razak's first patient of the day is Muriel, an elderly woman who recently suffered a mini-stroke. She is reluctant to take her blood pressure medication because she has an aversion to drugs - but as the doctor explains, not doing so could make things even worse. Elaine asks Dr Costigan to give her painful knee a once-over and 92-year-old Elizabeth comes in for her regular heart check-up

programme.title: Born Free (1966)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: Man of the West (1958)
programme.desc: Reformed outlaw Link is left stranded in the wilderness with a saloon singer and a conman for company when the train they are travelling on is robbed. By chance they stumble upon Link's old gang holed up in a shack, but his former partners in crime threaten violence against them unless Link agrees to take part in a bank robbery. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Lee J Cobb, Julie London and Arthur O'Connell

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Flight (2012)
programme.desc: An airline pilot with a history of heavy drinking and drug use successfully lands a plane that suffers mechanical problems during a fierce storm, saving the lives of nearly everyone on board. While initially hailed as a hero, it later emerges that he was drunk at the time, raising questions about whether he may have contributed to the disaster rather than averted it. Drama, starring Denzel Washington and Don Cheadle

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk (2008)
programme.desc: A bungled experiment causes a scientist to turn into a monster whenever he gets angry. He travels the world seeking a cure for his condition, while a ruthless general is determined to capture him and use the creature as a weapon. However, one of the soldiers under the officer's command undergoes a terrifying transformation of his own. Comic-book adventure, starring Edward Norton, Liv Tyler, Tim Roth and William Hurt

programme.title: Rings (2017)
programme.desc: A young woman finds herself on the receiving end of a terrifying curse that threatens to take her life in seven days. Horror, starring Matilda Anna Ingrid Lutz, Alex Roe and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Barnyard (2006)
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Failure to Launch (2006)

programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell (2017)
programme.desc: A cybernetically enhanced soldier designed to battle the world's deadliest criminals faces a new threat - a terrorist who has developed the ability to hack into people's minds and control them. The mission brings to light disturbing secrets about her own past, and the possibility that her whole life is a lie. Sci-fi adventure, starring Scarlett Johansson, Pilou Asbk and Juliette Binoche

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who are revealed to them one body part at a time. This time, 30-year-old Pablo, who is HIV positive and hopes to break the stigma about his condition, and Leon, a musician and rapper from Burnley, take part

programme.title: Absolutely Dyer: Danny and Dani Do Italy
programme.desc: On the final leg of their tour of Italy, Danny and Dani explore the importance of money and wealth and try to figure out what makes them truly happy. They sample true luxury on a visit to Milan and spend a day appreciating nature and the simple life in a commune in the foothills of the Alps, before rounding off their adventure at Lake Como

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron continue their quest to adopt another child, enlisting the help of Gloria as a translator. Jay and Manny are left alone to look after Lily as she prepares for a dance recital, while Claire and Phil send Alex off to her first prom. Haley causes a stir when she announces her future plans

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Competitive golf-loving couple Lynn and Mike from Southampton have been holidaying in Spain for 40 years and even lived there previously. They love it so much they now wish to now buy a holiday home there, so Danni Menzies lines up five options for their 60,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Yorkshire glampsite owner diversifies into olive oil farming in Italy, a cook from Birmingham teaches vegan cooking in France, and a couple are determined to rebuild their lives in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head to Worcestershire where Max transforms old air tanks into a sports car, while Simon makes a trendy bar bench out of old barrels

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to the north of Wales where they meet Sue, who is clearing out her late husband's antique shop stock. Henry manages to find a pedal car, while Simon takes a toy yacht

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives receive a case from America with a strong showbusiness connection, and must trace the relatives of a woman who left the UK as a child in 1936. Plus, the story of a man adopted as a boy leads to an exotic tale of life on the island of Bermuda

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The race is on to find heirs to the 100,000 estate of a woman from Southsea, and the search uncovers the romantic story of a husband and wife who met while serving in the Navy. Plus, an heir seeks to learn more about her aunts and uncles and makes a poignant discovery about her mother's twin brother. The programme also provides details of other unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: First to host in Manchester at Hayden's Kitchen at The Gallows, in Milnrow, Rochdale, are husband-and-wife team, chef David and front of house staff Rachel, who are hoping to wow their guests with their posh pub grub. The rival restaurateurs they're out to impress are Saju and Ganga from Amma's Canteen, and Jo and Mike from The Waterside

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Rebecca struggle to get their kilometre-long driveway ready for the arrival of their guests. Amy and Marc unearth an original medieval fireplace

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Royal Marine captain Jon's life changed for ever when he stepped onto a land mine in Afghanistan and lost three limbs. After viewing many uninspiring specialist homes and considering awkward conversions, he and partner Becky realised their best option was to build a property themselves. The design is cutting-edge, with sleek glass walls, open-plan spaces and a dramatic wing-like roof, and the couple want there to be no noticeable adaptations. However, they soon use up their budget of 250,000 and encounter problems with their incredibly tight schedule. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris
programme.desc: An auction of the highly prized Corpus Hermeticum with an audience of specialists and collectors in attendance ends in mysterious circumstances when the auctioneer becomes delirious and winds up dead. When a Tarot card - the Fool - is found in his pocket, the mystery for Astrid and Raphaelle thickens. Sara Mortensen stars. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ex-paratrooper Martin, who's 48, has sustained multiple life-changing injuries to his neck, pelvis and legs after his paraglider was blown into a hillside, and is rushed to hospital by emergency helicopter. Meanwhile, doctors treat 73-year-old Eddie for severe sepsis, and 72-year-old Graham, suffering from a constant nose bleed due to the blood-thinners he is taking, is also treated

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Glyn, 53, is brought in by ambulance after a work-related accident on a building site, and in his hour of need he turns to his lifelong friend Barrie. Eighteen-month-old Zemirah's parents are concerned with her diarrhoea and vomiting and 93-year-old John is admitted after falling at home, but also has a severe case of sepsis

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy game show, with Sean Lock and Greg Davies taking on Jon Richardson and Holly Walsh. Susie Dent is joined by Vic Reeves in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson join forces with Jason Manford and Roisin Conaty respectively. Sam Simmons helps the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ex-paratrooper Martin, who's 48, has sustained multiple life-changing injuries to his neck, pelvis and legs after his paraglider was blown into a hillside, and is rushed to hospital by emergency helicopter. Meanwhile, doctors treat 73-year-old Eddie for severe sepsis, and 72-year-old Graham, suffering from a constant nose bleed due to the blood-thinners he is taking, is also treated

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Briony May Williams finds out why some radishes are hotter than others. Andi Oliver wonders why pre-made sandwiches seem to invariably have mayonnaise in them, while Kate Quilton heads north to the Scottish isles to discover how they are growing truffles

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt discovers why some fruits are hairier than others, while Kate Quilton learns what's the difference between single and double cream. Plus, Briony May Williams examines the science of canned food and it can last so long

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of 100,000 to find a suitable property

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tracey and Dean met in their early twenties and have devoted their lives to raising their family, including their own three children and two foster children. Now that they are finally in a position to buy a holiday home in the Mar Menor in Spain, Jasmine Harman is on hand to show them five properties for their 70,000 budget

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt gets a rare up-close encounter with some gigantic elephant seals on California's Pacific coast and meets a flower farmer in the hills of Rainbow who has managed to perfect growing beautiful blooms on the steep slopes. Up in Pioneertown, the presenter meets the residents of a real life wild-west town that was originally created for the movies before hiking out in the Santa Rosa mountains. Finally, he stops in Santa Cruz to find out why the coast became the birthplace of surfing in mainland USA

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: New Zealander Steve Levy kicks off a week of dinner parties in Exeter, where he hopes his home-inspired menu consisting of a prawn starter, a fish main course and two desserts will impress his guests - administrator Estelle Macrow, media sales executive Richard Kaye, customer services adviser Sarah Wallis and PR guru Glen King - and make him an early contender for the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Media sales executive and music mad foodie Richard Kaye hosts the second dinner party in Exeter, where he is confident he can impress his guests with his culinary knowledge, and hopes to dazzle one diner in particular

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Self-assured PR worker Glen King is confident she will be the 'hostess with the mostest' in Exeter, and has gone all-out to impress - even co-ordinating the dishes with her surname. She appears to be unflappable in the kitchen and seems to have a plan for everything to fall perfectly into place - but will it?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer services adviser Sarah Wallis is the fourth host in Exeter, and despite holding back all week she hopes to come out of her shell with an evening full of humour. The guests are welcomed in a terrifying manner, before being served some rather unusual cocktails

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Exeter, singleton Estelle Macrow is keen to discover whether she has the ability to successfully host a dinner party. Sarah Wallis, music-mad food connoisseur Richard Kaye, New Zealander Steve Levy and PR bod Glen King await her piece de resistance

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Dubbed 'The Beast' by Winston Churchill, Tirpitz was Nazi Germany's most powerful battleship. Protected by an elite squadron of fighters, it was seen as invincible, but after 34 failed attempts to sink it, the RAF sent in the 617 'Dambusters' Squadron and 9 Squadron. In a raid in November 1944 they managed to slip through enemy defences and destroy Tirpitz. With eyewitness accounts from surviving RAF crew, one of the Luftwaffe fighter pilots and German sailors, this documentary tells this extraordinary story and offers new evidence to explain the mission's improbable success

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on a neglected 1988 Fiat Uno Turbo belonging to former car salesman Gerry, who has been struck down with ill health

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at King's College Hospital and St George's in south London. Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while carpenter Luke has come into A&E with his girlfriend Stacy, having cut his finger at work

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Danny, who's 41, is brought into hospital after falling 20 feet through a skylight onto concrete. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Tara receives treatment for her severe abdominal pains, and three-year-old Clara is brought to A&E by her mum, with a chickpea stuck up her nose

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Maria, a 52-year-old woman who suffers from MS, is brought in with suspected sepsis. As doctors work to regulate her temperature, her husband Duncan talks about their life together and how they supported each other through her diagnosis. Meanwhile, Eve, who's 83, is in A&E with her husband John after she fell down the stairs into her basement, suffering an open ankle fracture. Elsewhere, six-year-old Grace has come to hospital with her dad Ben after getting a piece of tissue stuck inside her ear

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show's version of the popular and long-running words-and-numbers quiz. Regular team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Johnny Vegas and Katherine Ryan to provide more comic innuendos, festive surprises and laughs aplenty. Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent takes her usual place in Dictionary Corner with David O'Doherty, while mathematics whizz Rachel Riley is on hand to provide the letters and numbers

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Isy Suttie to go up against Jon Richardson and Richard Osman in the comedy words-and-numbers quiz. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Danny, who's 41, is brought into hospital after falling 20 feet through a skylight onto concrete. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Tara receives treatment for her severe abdominal pains, and three-year-old Clara is brought to A&E by her mum, with a chickpea stuck up her nose

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Maria, a 52-year-old woman who suffers from MS, is brought in with suspected sepsis. As doctors work to regulate her temperature, her husband Duncan talks about their life together and how they supported each other through her diagnosis. Meanwhile, Eve, who's 83, is in A&E with her husband John after she fell down the stairs into her basement, suffering an open ankle fracture. Elsewhere, six-year-old Grace has come to hospital with her dad Ben after getting a piece of tissue stuck inside her ear

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The return of the series uncovering secrets behind mass-produced food. Matt Tebbutt finds out why the shelf life for a vegetable stir-fry mix is so short, Jimmy Doherty uncovers the sweet secret of how ice lolly makers get such perfect layers in a rocket lolly and Kate Quilton travels to Portugal to discover just what piri-piri is

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of ingenious small builds, meeting people creating places to live, work and play in the most unlikely of places. Here he meets a couple who turned an old fire engine into a bar to raise money for firefighters' charities and a 23-year-old who built a shepherd's hut from scratch, including the nuts and bolts. George also visits an extraordinary home in Chile and Will Hardie builds a telescope

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Darren and Hannah from Heathfield, East Sussex, want to redesign their bungalow on a budget of 45,000, so George Clarke introduces the couple to award-winning architect Carl Turner. He proposes a radical revamp, to be done in stages as finances allow. But with another baby on the way, Darren is keen for the family to get the most space possible now. With money running out and the roof leaking, will the refurb be completed in time for the new arrival?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George's continued renovation mission takes him to Moseley and Wheaton Aston in the West Midlands. He begins with a conversion to unite upstairs and downstairs flats in an Arts and Crafts building, although one of his suggestions leaves the owners speechless. He also visits an 18th-century pub that has fallen victim to some dodgy DIY - and quickly devises a clever plan to make the most of the period features

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alarm-company owner Bill Black kicks off a series of dinner parties in Dundee, where he hopes his belt-busting menu will impress his guests - proud Arbroathian Phil Petrie, English student Hannah Wilson, ferret fancier Alex Pithouse and 28-year-old Kim Gillespie - and make him an early contender for the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Architectural technician Alex Pithouse hosts the second dinner party in Dundee, and aims to impress his guests by giving them an education in fine dining, complete with a complex menu and some good wines, as well as by introducing them to his three pet ferrets

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Hannah Wilson prepares an Italian feast for her guests in Dundee, and in a bid to win over her carnivore guests she devises a cunning plan that involves dishing up some meat with the starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth night in Dundee is hosted by self-styled food critic Phil Petrie, who has been unimpressed with the culinary standard so far. He hopes to impress with his evening, but things begin to go wrong when he runs out of ingredients and leaves his guests feeling hungry

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Dundee, Kim Gillespie plans an ambitious menu, largely based on Yorkshire delights, with exotic dishes from Spain and Thailand also featuring - all accompanied by a Scottish choir singing American songs

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring rapper Warren Temple kicks off a week of dinner parties in Peterborough, where he hopes his Spanish-influenced menu will impress his guests - ethical trader Donna Trafford, glamour model Susie Hutson, straight-talking professional Vicki Culverhouse and veterinary nurse Robin Hills - and make him an early contender for the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ethical trader Donna Trafford hosts the second night in Peterborough, and plans to wow her guests with a colourful evening of tasty food and relaxed fun in a bid to win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third night in Peterborough, glamour model and columnist Susie Hutson is out to prove she's not the dizzy blonde some of the guests assume she is - and it doesn't take long for ethical trader Donna Trafford and would-be rapper Warren Temple to make an unexpected discovery that proves there's more to Susie than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Straight-talking businesswomen Vicki Culverhouse hosts the fourth night of the competition in Peterborough. She surprises the group when she unleashes some poetry at the dinner table, after having been very direct with the other diners throughout the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary nurse Robin Hills is the final host of the competition in Peterborough. He prepares an animal-themed evening, accompanied by well-presented cuisine, which he hopes will be a big hit with his guests

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Memorable cases, including a retired firefighter accidentally hit in the face by a golf club - whose wife reflects on the irony of him coming to greater harm on the golf course than in a burning building. Plus, a former marine who badly dislocated his thumb after falling off a bicycle, who enjoys the effects of the pain-killing gas and air while reflecting on the evolutionary benefits of risk

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics on the night shift find a woman collapsed on the floor and on the verge of a diabetic coma. With no access to her veins and time running out, the team resort to drastic measures. A young woman is in agony with severe stomach cramps. Every time she gets up, her blood pressure drops and she passes out. It's a medical mystery that needs further investigation in hospital

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A surfer has a heart attack in the water, and doctors are not sure they can save him. A self-confessed 'idiot' needs treatment after falling out of a tree while holding a chainsaw. Dr Mya reassures a woman with leg injuries after she was squashed between her motorbike and a four-wheel-drive, while a teenager with a machete wound to his arm has Dr Michael on alert

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A visitor to the Appleby horse fair in Cumbria needs emergency intervention after a cardiac arrest, a 12-year-old girl is treated for multiple injuries after a collision with a vehicle, while in Co Durham, a man is found confused and injured after a fall while walking in the countryside

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun has to confront prejudice from an unlikely source when he takes on the case of a patient with autism. Medical drama, starring Freddie Highmore

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics on the night shift find a woman collapsed on the floor and on the verge of a diabetic coma. With no access to her veins and time running out, the team resort to drastic measures. A young woman is in agony with severe stomach cramps. Every time she gets up, her blood pressure drops and she passes out. It's a medical mystery that needs further investigation in hospital

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A visitor to the Appleby horse fair in Cumbria needs emergency intervention after a cardiac arrest, a 12-year-old girl is treated for multiple injuries after a collision with a vehicle, while in Co Durham, a man is found confused and injured after a fall while walking in the countryside

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Briony May Williams is in Germany to uncover why schnapps is always clear despite being made from bright, colourful fruits. Kate Quilton learns why supermarkets carry so many variations of the same herbs, while Jimmy Doherty finds out if there is any difference between soft and crusty bread rolls

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom Ford sets his heart on a Ford Fiesta Mk1 from Spain and convinces the others to splash the cash - but there's a surprise in store then the Lazy Boys see the car in person

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom 'Wookie' Ford thinks sourcing a cool retro van that someone can use to sell coffee in is a no-brainer, and the boys find a Renault 4F6 - but can they make a profit at auction?

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A woman is suspected of smuggling someone else's baby over the border. Drugs are found hidden in a consignment of carrots. A pill smuggler is caught following an earlier tip-off

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Armed police and drug squad officers arrest three men after a dangerous social media posting, and a man fails a breathalyser after crashing his moped

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As auctioneer Sean Kelly and the team arrive in Gwent, Heavy D confuses the other bidders and himself. Meanwhile, Nat takes a gamble, but John is far from happy

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip reaches a conclusion as he arrives in Istanbul, just in time for the bluefish season, which allows him the chance to enjoy a fishing expedition on the Bosphorus, one of the world's most strategic waterways, which divides the city into two continents. Rick also cooks two much-loved local dishes - lavish kofte kebabs with pistachios, and kapuska, a hearty traditional Turkish cuisine stew from the Black Sea region, whose name is derived from the Russian word for cabbage

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britain's most talented detectives pursue two gunmen killers in Northamptonshire, distraction burglars in sleepy Kent, and a multi-million-pound footwear scam in Manchester

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on alert for a cartel ambush as they transfer a Sicario to the Mexican military. A random inspection of a pick-up truck reveals 32kg of narcotics

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. They design a vehicle for elderly people and put it to the test in Dorset with the help of three pensioners. Meanwhile, James May gets acquainted with a revamped Range Rover in London before pitting the luxurious off-roader against an autonomous military machine in Nevada. Actor James McAvoy tackles the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Three boy racers compete against police pursuit drivers as they remotely operate cars in destructive challenges. Presented by Colin Murray

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges his five fearful funny people to entertain him by completing more baffling challenges, which this week involve corneas, crackers and construction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mathematician Rachel Riley, singer and farmer JB Gill, radio presenter Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring test their general knowledge skills, with an overall champion being crowned for the week

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Chris Hollins, Gregg Wallace, Holly Walsh and Charlene White go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Cameras follow old friends Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer as they embark on an angling trip round the UK. The first stop is Norfolk, and while fishing for tench, Bob tries to impress Paul with his childhood fishing rod - and fails. They share nostalgia for their younger years and reveal how they recently came face to face with their own mortality due to heart disease

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for barbel in Hay-on-Wye, and sample the great outdoors in spectacular fashion when Mortimer decides to strip in celebration of their catch. Passing a graveyard, they muse about the future and chat to a local vicar about death and their own funerals. To lighten the mood, back in their wooden fishing cabin, Bob promises Paul a very special treat if they are successful with their angling efforts

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons

Rick also cooks two much-loved local dishes - lavish kofte kebabs with pistachios, and kapuska, a hearty traditional Turkish cuisine stew from the Black Sea region, whose name is derived from the Russian word for cabbage

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Comedy actors Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer travel to the picturesque River Usk in south Wales, where Paul's father first taught him to fish as a young child. The duo discuss their respective childhoods and reflect on their own family lives and values. In their cosy cottage accommodation in the heart of the countryside they compare school photographs and Paul serenades Bob with his guitar. Once outside in the picturesque environment, their quarry is the wild brown trout

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer brave the wild lakes of Essex in search of the mighty carp. They have the latest high-tech equipment to catch the biggest fish they can - and are fully prepared to stay all night if they have to. The pair discuss the true meaning of a mid-life crisis and decide to visit a beauty clinic to see whether there are any suitable treatments available to re-capture their youth. Bob reveals his secret recipe to make the perfect scrambled eggs - but it's not the only thing that shocks Paul

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.desc: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey from the Irish Sea to the North Sea continues by tram from Manchester. At the imposing town hall of the world's first industrial city, he comes face to face with the Victorian scientist who invented modern atomic theory. The latest stage ends at Silkstone Common, where he tracks down the forge where a Victorian metallurgist created wrought iron axles strong enough for railway rolling stock

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael starts his journey in Chapeltown, Sheffield, following what was once known as the North Country Continental service, and finishing in the engineering centre of Doncaster

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to London's West End as he explores 19th-century engineering used in theatres, and learns about the ambitious building programme that saw Trafalgar Square replace slums. He indulges in some retail therapy at a Piccadilly Circus perfumery patronised by kings, queens and prime ministers, and finds out how diseases were rife in Victorian London on a visit to Soho

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on his final journey in London, exploring Albertopolis in south Kensington and reaching dizzying heights inside a Victorian landmark. programme.desc: The Mathewsons sell a 1958 Bedford D122 and a 1969 Vanden Plas Princess. They also meet a collector who may be willing to finally part with his 220-car collection

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey 'frogeye' Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave's son Jack heads to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference, and luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly what's been brought in for auction

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a dense forest near the Czech capital of Prague that hides Houska Castle, an eerie castle rumoured to possess supernatural powers

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Serbia, Fort Pike in Louisiana, and a mountainside refuge in Georgia that was revealed to the world by an act of God

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a grand structure in Hull that was reduced to rubble by Hitler's planes, Casa Albero in Italy, USS Hornet in California and the Sofia tunnels

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states. In New Haven, a crash course in rowing takes place on a stretch of water where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory since 1852. Making tracks north to Vermont, Michael experiences 19th-century rural farm life, when its green pastures made it the butter capital of the world

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Montreal, Michael Portillo discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city's construction, cuisine and culture. Undaunted by his guidebook's description of the treacherous Lachine Rapids, the one-time MP gets a thorough soaking on a white-knuckle boat ride down the St. Lawrence River. In the Canadian capital, Ottawa, Michael visits the country's parliament to hear about the birth of the new nation after Confederation in 1867. And at Ottawa's historic Central Experimental Farm, Michael hears of the pioneering discoveries, which launched a Canadian wheat boom

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves the tracks for a nautical pilgrimage through the Thousand Islands, visiting Fort Henry in the port city of Kingston, Ontario, and learning about the antics of 19th-century high-wire walker the Great Farini in Port Hope. He then heads to Oshawa to look around the home of the McLaughlin family, who helped build a new economy for Canada, before his journey across Canada concludes in Toronto

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, embarking on the first leg of a journey across Alaska. He begins his journey amid the snow-capped mountains of the Kenal Peninsula, where he discovers that 150 years ago, Alaska was a Russian colony. Moving on, in Seward he feeds a rescued sea otter with a fearsome bite and in Anchorage he joins the US Arctic Warriors for parachute training

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to explore Alaska, from the remote former goldrush settlement of Talkeetna to the railwayless state capital, Juneau. Along the way, he helps a homesteader fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin, discovers how 100 years ago photographers captured the beauty of the Alaskan landscape and meets scientists studying the Northern Lights

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The next leg of Michael Portillo's journey begins in Skagway, Alaska, where he learns about writer Jack London, one of the gold prospectors who hiked to the Klondike 100 years ago. He then crosses into Canada on the White Pass and Yukon railway. Along the way he is invited to shake his tail feathers in a grouse dance, heads for the home of the Vancouver Giants, tries his hand at ice hockey and visits the Canadian Motion Picture Park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The second leg of Michael Portillo's journey from Liverpool to Scarborough takes him from Manchester to Bury. Along the way, he finds out about the life of Victorian train enthusiast George Bradshaw, gets fitted for a trilby hat in Denton, and learns how railways helped contribute to the nation's love affair with fish and chips

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey, travelling on the Embsay and Bolton Abbey steam railway, finding out about Roman discoveries in York, and taking to the air in the Network Rail helicopter

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey inspired by George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook. He searches for the last liquorice grower in Pontefract, finds out how the railways transformed Hull into one of the largest white-fish ports in the world, and goes fishing for sea bass in Bridlington

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In East Yorkshire, Michael Portillo goes bird-watching on the cliffs of Flamborough Head before travelling to Filey in North Yorkshire, where he learns to decipher traditional knitting patterns. He then continues his journey to the Victorian seaside resort of Scarborough, and views a 4,000-year-old skeleton called Gristhorpe Man

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the first leg of his second journey, Michael Portillo heads to Kirkcaldy in Fife, finding out along the way how the mill town of Preston in Lancashire gave birth to the Temperance Movement. After a stroll along the pier with local comedian Joey Blower, Michael visits Morecambe Bay

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Preston to Kirkcaldy, returning to the historic Settle-Carlisle line he helped save from dereliction when he was Minister of State for Transport in the 1980s. Here, engineer Tony Feshini describes what life was like for the people who originally built Ribblehead Viaduct, before Michael visits Dent, Cumbria, home to the highest railway station in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey following George Bradshaw's footsteps, as the third leg of his trip from Preston to Kirkcaldy sees him embarking on a two-day tour of the Lake District. He begins in Windermere, where he travels by steamboat to the north of the lake, and continues to Claife viewing station, where he learns about the water pollution caused by increasing levels of tourism. He spends the night in Grasmere, and the following day reaches Kendal, where he buys local delicacies and meets a farmer who explains the impact of railways on farming practices

In the first edition, DJ Dom kicks off the week serving up a menu inspired by the 1990s 'Madchester' music scene

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee barrister Sasha hosts the second night in Manchester, where she hopes to impress her guests with a Chinese-Pakistani fusion menu. Meanwhile, fellow contestant Maria reveals more about her love of gothic culture, and Danny discusses his soon-to-be-written autobiography

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Katherine hosts the third dinner party in Manchester, and she opts for a simple menu of a smoked salmon with horseradish cream starter, and a chorizo and chickpea main course. At the table, direct questioning and some extraordinary revelations cause some of the guests to feel uncomfortable

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Danny hosts the fourth night of the competition in Manchester, and decides on an evening of Bulgarian cuisine as a homage to his wife. His party ends with some Bulgarian language lessons that bemuse fellow diners Dom and Maria

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night in Manchester and glamorous goth Maria is hoping to wow her guests with her twist on Asian cuisine. Some of the guests are feeling a little uneasy that the host will impart her love of vampire culture upon her menu, but the blood-free dishes even manage to impress daddy's girl Sasha. However, an avant-garde transgender dancer creates a stir, and at one point it seems possible that Maria has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat 15-year-old Meldred, who has been stabbed in the thigh by a stranger while walking to school, and are concerned that the knife may have caused significant damage or internal bleeding. The medical staff also try to diagnose what is wrong with sports commentator Andrew, who has an inflamed ankle with blood spots and a rash, and treat 11-year-old Penelope, who has hurt her finger falling in the playground

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: On the beat with the police officers of Brighton after dark. Young officers Matt and Will stop an ex-police chief for suspected driving under the influence. But things turn awkward when it turns out she isn't. Determined to prove themselves they attend a suspected arson where they are determined to catch the culprit. Sophie and Rachel investigate a possible street assault that has left a man with life-threatening injuries and Steve comes across a pair of legs sticking out of the bushes. The question is - whose are they?

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The police in Bradford pursue a team of suspected car thieves, travelling at speeds of 80mph. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: On the A1 near Leeds, an intoxicated driver rams a police car before heading the wrong way down the dual carriageway and the cops instigate a risky containment manoeuvre to bring him to a standstill. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: The team investigates the bombing of a helicopter that left all six passengers dead. Real-life husband and wife Michael McKean and Annette O'Toole guest star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A teacher's body is found in the boot of her car. Suspicions that she was having an affair are soon confirmed, but the case takes a sinister turn when the trail leads to her husband and fanatical father-in-law. Jerry Orbach stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a wealthy art patron is found murdered and her body mutilated, the team's inquiries lead to failed painter Larry Brunig, who objected to the obscene nature of the art supported and promoted by the victim - and a probe into his past reveals a violent history

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress e-mail server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This 'lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late father taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The bodies of five people, all of whom are identified as being from the US Navy, are found on the floor of a diner, and all are connected to a suspicious tax firm that specialises in helping people who are in arrears. When further killings are linked to the business, the team realises the crime seem to be copycats of previous cases. Meanwhile, two of Gibbs' ex-wives appear at the location with something important to discuss with the agent. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and his colleagues investigate when Eric Kutzler, the first openly gay Navy lieutenant tipped to receive the Medal of Honour, is murdered. While the agents initially suspect Kutzler's death was the result of a hate crime, the fact that his police officer husband waited 20 minutes to report the crime suggests he had something to hide. Meanwhile, the team throws a baby shower for Palmer as his wife's due date approaches. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Crime drama, starring Richard Belzer

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

However, when the teenager inexplicably contacts his mother while the detectives are questioning her, it quickly becomes clear this is a case of mistaken identity, and the real Andrew was with the murder victim in a romantic capacity. They propose that he murdered his boyfriend in a jealous rage - a possibility that becomes more likely with the news that Andrew spent time in a psychiatric ward for schizophrenia

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape and murder of Laura Santiago, an animal rights campaigner who had been working on a documentary exposing shocking facts about the meat-processing industry. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Leslie Nielsen and Susan Clark

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The crafty detective pits his wits against a brilliant defence lawyer who has never lost a case. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Little Richard, Dabney Coleman, Shera Danese, Cheryl Paris and Julian Stone

programme.title: Mark of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The stories of murderers who could not resist leaving a distinguishing mark on each of their victims. The first episode focuses on the killer responsible for the deaths of young women along Route 40 in Delaware. But when police go undercover, the hunter becomes the hunted

programme.title: Britain's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old church warden Ben Field, who was jailed in 2019 for the murder of Peter Farquhar, 69, whom he duped into a fake relationship and persuaded to change his will, before drugging him with a cocktail of pills

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of Velma Barfield, the first woman to be executed by lethal injection after taking six lives, asking what drove her to commit these callous murders

programme.title: Killer in My Village
programme.desc: An obsessive gambler murders his wealthy friend before adopting his identity to fund his extravagant lifestyle

programme.title: Night Cops
programme.desc: Police in Crewe use their persuasive powers to calm down an excitable youth, Wrexham officers rush to the aid of a colleague in distress, and policemen in Torquay help a woman who was knocked to the ground by her boyfriend

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino can't find one of his books because he can't remember where he left it; Mama Mama teaches the children to treasure their books.

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino and Fino learn about recycling and the importance of saving the environment.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering is about to give a valuation for a client when the man dies. This leads the Baron and Cordelia to an old dark house in the country where mysterious goings on have been reported

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost, charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost, charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White takes you Thameside to explore the wonderful world of Mudlarking. In this episode, Nicola unravels the story of two soldiers from London who fought in WWI.

programme.title: Sara Dane
programme.desc: Historical drama about a woman transported to a penal colony in Australia for a crime she did not commit

programme.title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum (1966)
programme.desc: A conniving slave in ancient Rome tries to win his freedom by helping his lovestruck master romance a virginal courtesan. Comedy musical, starring Zero Mostel, Phil Silvers, Michael Hordern and Buster Keaton

programme.title: Penny Paradise (1938)
programme.desc: A tug boat captain quits his job after winning the football pools, but finds that being rich may not be all it is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring Edmund Gwenn and Betty Driver

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Jono calls on Antony to help him build a funky glass house, and Poh cooks the boys lunch and goes fishing

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Sara develop three unique ice cream flavours, and back home, Poh whips up a batch of butter chicken and leaves it on the doorstep of her neighbour

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: A magistrate's daughter is kidnapped by bandits, prompting Monkey to mount a daring rescue mission. Fantasy adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As Rick and Molly's wedding approaches, the girls enjoy a wild hen night surrounded by booze and naked men. But as the party gets into full swing, Mary makes a shocking announcement - she's three months' pregnant. William is delighted with the news, but has enough to worry about when the firm is asked to conduct its first Chinese funeral, complete with fireworks. Meanwhile, Kate and Brendan try to slip away together for a night of passion - but next door's rampant rabbit Baldrick soon throws a spanner in the works. Starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Michael Begley and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Muck and Brass
programme.desc: Drama, starring Mel Smith as a property developer who manipulates and negotiates his way through local politics in a midlands town. Originally broadcast in 1982

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: A guilt-stricken Trudi seeks guidance from Katie, but is unsure whether she will be able to live with her conscience. Siobhan's realisation that Dominic has moved on with his life prompts her to go on a date with Jeff the photographer, Jessica is concerned when Mark contemplates another risky investment, and Vivienne warns Richard to stay away from her daughter. Drama, starring Sharon Small and Sarah Parish

programme.title: The Man in the Glass Booth (1975)
programme.desc: A rich Jewish industrialist is stunned to find himself abducted and taken to Israel, where he is accused of being a Nazi war criminal _ could the allegation be true? Searing drama adapted from Robert Shaw's acclaimed play, starring Maximilian Schell, Lois Nettleton, Luther Adler and Lawrence Pressman

programme.title: Sword of Honour
programme.desc: Concluding part of Evelyn Waugh's Second World War trilogy. Dispatched to Crete on a mission, Guy finds himself in the middle of a military fiasco. Starring Daniel Craig

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures.

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: A woman who witnesses gangsters disposing of a body flees in terror. Mannering is enlisted to track her down and obtain her statement

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels around the UK coast by train, beginning by boarding the famous Jacobite steam train for a trip along Scotland's West Highland Railway, famously featured in the Harry Potter movies. Along the way, Julie learns about herring gutting and blowing up railway lines, and meets a traditional Scottish storyteller on the Isle of Skye

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Cat Hospital takes viewers inside Ireland's first purpose-built veterinary clinic that caters exclusively for cats.

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary series following dogs and their trainers as they learn to sniff out drugs and find roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How the German leader managed to escape assassination several times thanks to his handpicked bodyguards. Alpine isolation proved a tempting target for many of Hitler's enemies, including the SAS

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: A farmer discovers his animals are dying of a mysterious disease after the water supply is poisoned - a contamination that could start to affect humans. With Warren Clarke

programme.title: Blessed (2008)
programme.desc: A successful city trader abandons the modern world after losing everything he ever cared about, and lives a hermit's existence on a remote Scottish island. However, the arrival of a little girl shakes him out of his misery and isolation and encourages him to rejoin the outside world. Drama, starring James Nesbitt, Natascha McElhone, Gary Lewis and Lil Woods

programme.title: The Careless Years (1957)
programme.desc: A working class teenager pursues a romance with a girl from a rich family, but when both sets of parents disapprove of the relationship, he hatches a plan for them to flee to Mexico and get married in secret. Drama, starring Dean Stockwell and Natalie Trundy

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White takes you Thameside with Monika and Anna to explore the wonderful world of Mudlarking, unearthing the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Newcastle to Edinburgh by high speed train. Along the way, she stops off at the coastal town of Alnmouth, discovers where the phrase Keep Calm and Carry On originated, visits the world's biggest gannet colony, and goes out to sea with a lobster breeder. When she reaches her destination, she discovers the connection between the railway and the famous Balmoral Hotel

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of US Airways Flights 1549, which lost engine power after a collision with a flock of birds, leaving Captain Sully Sullenberger to land the plane on the Hudson River

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: A guilt-stricken Trudi seeks guidance from Katie, but is unsure whether she will be able to live with her conscience. Siobhan's realisation that Dominic has moved on with his life prompts her to go on a date with Jeff the photographer, Jessica is concerned when Mark contemplates another risky investment, and Vivienne warns Richard to stay away from her daughter. Drama, starring Sharon Small and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Drama, starring Liam Neeson and Miranda Richardson. A married man discovers he is HIV-positive, and he and his wife must cope with the consequences

programme.title: Her Private Hell (1968)
programme.desc: An Italian woman comes to London to seek her fortune, but is seduced into a seedy world of nude modelling. Drama, starring Lucia Modugno and Terence Skelton

programme.title: Horror Hospital (1973)
programme.desc: An aspiring rock star is persuaded to take a relaxing break at a health farm, but gets a rude awakening on discovering his fellow guests all have identical scars on their foreheads. Horror, starring Michael Gough, Robin Askwith, Dennis Price and Vanessa Shaw

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost, charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost, charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
