programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: Tina Koumarianos, a former agony aunt who dreams of being a Roman Empress, is photographed at Glendalough with her bull mastiff, there is a visit to the National Reptile Zoo in Kilkenny and a jumper is made out of dog's wool.

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert revisits personal highlights from the programme, including an encounter with wild boar in Gloucestershire's Forest of Dean and exploring the grass chalklands of the South Downs. He also recalls sighting the rare fen raft spider in the Norfolk and Suffolk Broads and spotting short-eared owls hunting for voles in the Peak District

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Jono calls on Antony to help him build a funky glass house, and Poh cooks the boys lunch and goes fishing

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Sara develop three unique ice cream flavours, and back home, Poh whips up a batch of butter chicken and leaves it on the doorstep of her neighbour

programme.title: Fitzwilly (1967)
programme.desc: A loyal butler helps his impoverished, eccentric employer make donations to her favourite charities by leading a double life as a master criminal. Comedy, with Dick Van Dyke, Edith Evans, Barbara Feldon and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Penny Paradise (1938)
programme.desc: A tug boat captain quits his job after winning the football pools, but finds that being rich may not be all it is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring Edmund Gwenn and Betty Driver

programme.title: Screen One
programme.desc: One-off drama, starring Dawn French stars as a night-nurse in a geriatric ward who murders her patients and makes their deaths look like natural causes

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Blitz Spirit
programme.desc: Documentary series offering an insight into life for Londoners during the Blitz, which left much of the capital destroyed and claimed 30,000 lives, widening the gulf between rich and poor. The programme features personal testimony from people who lived through the period, and reveals how government information films and the Press played down much of the devastation. Narrated by Christopher Timothy

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Documentary exploring areas of the capital, beginning with Shooters Hill, Charlton, Greenwich and Blackheath

programme.title: The Boy Who Never Was (1980)
programme.desc: The son of the Busandi Ambassador is abducted, and attempts to outwit his kidnappers and escape. Thriller, starring Paul Alantis and Terence Alexander

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alphans find themselves in combat with an intelligent rock that will go to any lengths to secure their water for itself. Martin Landau and Patrick Mower star

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: A day in the life of glamour queen Taylor-Rae and her beloved Pekingese Coco. In Cork, Gillian prepares her dogs Nero and Arthur for the arrival of a new baby and in Belfast naughty Chihuahuas visit the vet

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the nutrient-rich waters around the Isle of Mull in the Inner Hebrides. There, he goes whale watching with local skipper James Fairburns, and comes face to face with the world's second-largest fish. Back on dry land, he observes an otter hunting along the coast, and meets David Sexton - the island's RSPB officer - to examine a white-tailed eagle nesting site

programme.title: Screen Two

programme.title: The Raging Moon (1971)
programme.desc: A footballer is unexpectedly rendered paraplegic and goes to live in a convalescence home, becoming completely cut off from his family. However, his relationship with another patient restores his passion for life. Romantic drama based on Peter Marshall's stage play, starring Malcolm McDowell and Nanette Newman

programme.title: Inseminoid (1981)
programme.desc: A group of scientists working on a remote planet attract the attentions of a bloodthirsty creature, which wastes no time in impregnating one of the women with its spawn. Impending motherhood begins to have some very strange effects - including sparking murderous rages and psychopathic tendencies - and the rest of the team battle to survive her attacks. Sci-fi horror, starring Judy Geeson, Robin Clarke, Jennifer Ashley and Stephanie Beacham
